html:
Refiles to fix syntax in 3rd bullet.

A round-up of notable broker activity this morning from Europe's top-ranked* analysts:


** JP Morgan sees 2021 as a year of recovery for the European automotive sector with 11% volume increase, and ups Continental CONG.DE to "overweight" from "neutral", but valuation leads it to cut BMW BMWG.DE to "neutral" from "overweight" (Full Story)

** UBS takes a positive view on British software group Aveva's AVV.L planned acquisition of peer OSIsoft (Full Story), seeing credible cost synergy plans, and potential revenue upside -- ups stock to "buy" from "neutral," adding "high growth prospects warrant a premium"

** Morgan Stanley says lower bond yields and robust investment market pricing will support portfolio valuations among European office stocks, but with rising supply, structural uncertainties remain; it cuts Land Securities LAND.L to "underweight" from "equal-weight"


INITIATIONS AND REINSTATEMENTS


** JP Morgan starts E.ON EONGn.DE with "neutral", saying the German utility company might secure a more favorable outcome from Germany's electricity networks 2021 review, yet lack of visibility on its German networks profitability and stretched balance sheet offer no positive short-term catalysts


(*Analyst rankings from Thomson Reuters StarMine. The scale is from 1-star to 5-star with 5 being the best. Analysts are ranked on earnings accuracy as well as relative performance of recommendations over trailing 12-month & 24-month periods.)



(( dagmarah.mackos@thomsonreuters.com ; aleksandra.majewska@thomsonreuters.com ))
